Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of San Francisco
Private Litigation Case Title: Cynthia Marciano Vs. Doordash, Inc. and Evan Kissner vs. Doordash Inc.

Description: The D.C. Attorney General announced a settlement with DoorDash, Inc., a food delivery service, requiring it to pay $2.5 million to resolve allegations that it misled D.C. consumers and used tips left for workers to boost the company's bottom line. In a November 2019 lawsuit, the Office of the Attorney General had alleged that from 2017 until 2019, DoorDash misled consumers to believe that their tips would increase worker pay, when, in fact, tips were used to subsidize DoorDash's payments to its workers. DoorDash has since revised its tips policy.

DoorDash agreed to pay more than $5 million to resolve allegations that it misclassified its delivery drivers as independent contractors to avoid providing sick leave and that it improperly used tip income to cover their base pay.
DoorDash agreed to pay $5.325 million in settlement of allegations it violated City ordinances on Health Care benefits and paid sick leave.
